segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose there was a boil that was many years old.

segments.pli: Tassassu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni.
segments.en: And that boil had nine orifices that were continually open wounds.

segments.pli: asuciyeva pagghareyya, duggandhaṃyeva pagghareyya, jegucchiyaṃyeva pagghareyya;
segments.en: would be filthy, stinking, and disgusting.

segments.pli: asuciyeva pasaveyya, duggandhaṃyeva pasaveyya, jegucchiyaṃyeva pasaveyya.
segments.en: would be filthy, stinking, and disgusting.

segments.pli: Gaṇḍoti kho, bhikkhave, imassetaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummāsūpacayassa aniccucchādanaparimaddanabhedanaviddhaṃsanadhammassa.
segments.en: ‘Boil’ is a term for this body made up of the four primary elements, produced by mother and father, built up from rice and porridge, liable to impermanence, to wearing away and erosion, to breaking up and destruction.

segments.pli: Tassassu gaṇḍassa nava vaṇamukhāni nava abhedanamukhāni.
segments.en: And that boil has nine orifices that are continually open wounds.

segments.pli: asuciyeva paggharati, duggandhaṃyeva paggharati, jegucchiyaṃyeva paggharati;
asuciyeva pasavati, duggandhaṃyeva pasavati, jegucchiyaṃyeva pasavati.

segments.en: So, mendicants, have no illusion about this body.”

suttaplex.blurb: The body is compared to a boil with nine orifices.
